message:
On trying to load linux from a USB, I encountered this error, it doesn't go beyond that. I didn't find any google documents on the matter
Anyone can help?

data.message:
Storage mistakes 8albn. Or bad sectors. Could be anything. Try another stick or any other ISO USB app. 
checksum the iso file as well.

Are you sure you tried Google? Here are some search results.

https://www.google.com.eg/webhp?sourceid=chrome-instant&ion=1&espv=2&ie=UTF-8#q=casper%2Fvmlinuz%20read%20error

Ahmed T. Al-Amir:This is my search result, perhaps I looked in a wrong manner. Thank you. 
Ahmad Mohammad: I tried the same USB stick on the computer lab in my university and you know how shitty they are.

I found this http://linustechtips.com/main/topic/40055-ubuntu-boot-loader-error/ by searching for this "boot loader read error usb". Note that the number is probably random based on which random file was corrupted so it doesn't help in searching. Also, I have found Google sometimes confused by symbols like "/", ":", "@", I'd usually replace them with spaces and/or put quotes around the "../../.." string.

a thousand thanks to you. as I am trying to install linux on a friend's laptop, I cant immediately test these solutions but I will inform you once I do.
thanks a lot again :)
